intro: Sphaerocoryne touranensis, commonly known as the Touranensis sphaerocoryne, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to specific regions in the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique, spherical or rounded fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry climates. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
